question: Which is the receptor for the immunosuppressive drug cyclosporin A (CsA)?
ideal_answer: Cyclophilin is the intracellular receptor protein for cyclosporin A  (CsA).

snippets.text: hemical modification of CsA has led to analogs with distinct biological activities associated with its protein receptor family, cyclophilins
These results would support cyclophilin as the major, if not only, intracellular receptor protein for CsA.
